body_html:
@sjperkins Simon: thanks, that makes perfect sense.

(What happens is: the BatchDatasetOp, compiled with NDEBUG in the stock tensorflow package, doesn't actually decrement the counter when it is equal to 1 and just calls the destructor. MyDatasetOp, compiled without NDEBUG, fails on assertion because the check is not cut out.)

body:
@sjperkins Simon: thanks, that makes perfect sense.

(What happens is: the BatchDatasetOp, compiled with NDEBUG in the stock tensorflow package, doesn't actually decrement the counter when it is equal to 1 and just calls the destructor. MyDatasetOp, compiled without NDEBUG, fails on assertion because the check is not cut out.)
